hypothesis_content.title: Liquidity Gap Reversal After News-Driven Selloff
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC experiences a >5% intraday drop on negative macro news (US budget/deficit headlines), but funding rates remain neutral/positive and spot volumes spike >200% of 20-day average, price will mean-revert 70% of the drop within 48 hours as liquidity providers refill order books.
hypothesis_content.rationale: News-driven selloffs often trigger stop-loss cascades and panic selling from weak hands, while sophisticated liquidity providers wait for volatility to subside before refilling bids. Neutral funding suggests no excessive leverage to unwind, and high spot volume indicates real selling pressure rather than just derivatives liquidations.
entry_conditions: BTC 4h close down >5% from previous 4h close
Negative macro news headline (US budget/deficit/crisis) within past 6 hours
Aggregated spot volume across top 5 exchanges >200% of 20-day average for same 4h period
Aggregated perpetual funding rate across exchanges between -0.01% and +0.02% (neutral)
BTC price at least 1.5% below VWAP of past 24h

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price reaches 70% retracement of the 5% drop (measured from entry to pre-drop high)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price drops further to 8% below entry price

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If price continues dropping >8% below entry despite neutral funding and high spot volume, indicating structural selling pressure beyond news reaction.
